thread.title: Long Island school desegregation in the 1960s
thread.title_full: Long Island school desegregation in the 1960s | Newsday

author: newsday.com
title: Long Island school desegregation in the 1960s
text:
Children take a break from picket line duty in 1962 outside Malverne High School, where groups were protesting the district's resistance to use busing to achieve desegregation. (Credit: Newsday/Marvin Sussman) 

"Walk right to school, and don't walk on anybody's lawn, because they don't want you there anyway," Frederick Brewington, who is black, recalled his mother saying before he left for school on Feb. 23, 1966, the day the court-ordered desegregation of the Malverne School District officially took effect.
While you're probably familiar with Brown vs. the Board of Education of Topeka â€” the 1954...
